data.title: First to write their name
data.solution:
gets
d=$<.map{|name|[name.chomp,name.downcase.bytes.max]}
min = d.map(&:last).min
puts d.sort.select{ |name,score| score == min }.map(&:first).join(' ')
data.statement:
At school, children learn to write letter by letter. They first learn to write A, then B, then C, etc. (both in upper and lower case). Given a list of names, who will be able to write their name first ?
In case of equality, print the names in alphabetic order separated by spaces

data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read firstname:string(20)
write firstname
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[n]] the number of names
<<[[n]] next lines :>> each [[name]], containing only letters
data.outputDescription: The names that would be learned first, separated by spaces

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

At school, children learn to write letter by letter. They first learn to write A, then B, then C, etc. (both in upper and lower case). Given a list of names, who will be able to write their name first ?
In case of equality, print the names in alphabetic order separated by spaces
Input
Line 1: n the number of names
n next lines : each name, containing only letters
Output
The names that would be learned first, separated by spaces
Constraints
1<=n<100
1<=length(firstname)<=20
Example
Input
6
Clement
Julien
Sebastien
Alexandre
Pierre
Christophe
Output
Pierre
